The Bodhisattva entered the city to beg for food. His deportment was dignified. He looked at the ground as he walked. At that time, he did not yet have a begging bowl. He held lotus flower petals. As he went along the road, the petals did not leave the roots.

After the king left, the Bodhisattva went to the Bodhi tree. Not far from the tree, he saw a man named Jianshan cutting grass. It is said:

Ignorance conditions formations, formations condition consciousness, consciousness conditions name-and-form, name-and-form conditions the six sense bases, the six sense bases condition contact, contact conditions feeling, feeling conditions craving, craving conditions grasping, grasping conditions becoming, becoming conditions birth, birth conditions old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.

If ignorance ceases, formations cease. If formations cease, consciousness ceases. If consciousness ceases, name-and-form ceases. If name-and-form ceases, the six sense bases cease. Having seen this meaning, he then spoke a verse, saying:

Covered by defiled desires, dark and nothing to be seen,

At that time, the World-Honored One, for this reason, remained silent and did not explain the Dharma.

' He thought again:
